intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. tirolensis, commonly known as the Alpine biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its hairy, often glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude ecosystems.
